description: (anus): From the old-fashioned practice of using dried corncobs instead of toilet paper in outdoor privies.

entries.meaning: (UK, dated) A small room connected to a threshing floor.
examples: A small room may be found opening off the threshing floor on one side […] This is the cornhole, a mid-eighteenth-century development so far known only in Staffordshire and Suffolk, with a few in east Sussex.

entries.meaning: (US) A game similar to beanbag toss, popular in Ohio, in which a bag is filled with corn feed and thrown into a hole.
examples: Cornhole, the indigenous pastime of Cincinnati's west side, is basically a democratized version of horseshoes.

verbs.description: cornhole (third-person singular simple present cornholes, present participle cornholing, simple past and past participle cornholed)

entries.meaning: (slang, vulgar) To have anal intercourse with; to penetrate anally.
